newsitem.title: USA: Diamond to partner with Symbios, sets up I/O unit.
newsitem.headline: Diamond to partner with Symbios, sets up I/O unit.

text.p: Diamond Multimedia Systems Inc said it will announce Monday formation of a new computer input/output division and a stategic alliance with Hyundai Symbios Logic Inc. subsidiary.

Diamond said the alliance will enable it to market its first PCI Ultra/Ultra-wide SCSI Host Adapter kit for PC users operating an Intel Pentium or Pentium Pro system on Microsoft Corp's Windows and Windows NT systems.

The new Ultra SCSI (small computer systems interface) kit is designed for multimedia applications which require intensive input and output between computer devices, such as large hard drives, compact disk recorders and scanners.

Diamond said its FirePort 40 PCI UltraSCSI Host Adapter Kit includes a PCI Ultra/Ultra-wide SCSI host adapter, drivers, a capble and mastering software for a suggested retail price of The FirePort 40 uses Symbios Logic's advanced SCSI reduced instruction set computing (RISC) script engine and is due to be available in early February for an estimated retail price of about $200 through Diamond's U.S. distribution channel and worldwide in March.

Symbios, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hyundai Electronics America, estimates its holds more than a third of the global SCSI chip markit, serving major computer makers like Compaq Computer Corp and Sun Microsystems Inc.

Symbios has granted Diamond Multimedia exclusivity in retail and commercial distribution channels for 18 months, the company said. The new division will be located at Diamond Multimedia's headquarter facilities in San Jose, Calif.
